PILS19.Description of CMU Components: The CMU at the Pilsworth North Landfill site near Bury will be made up of four reciprocating engines generating from natural gas. In their current state, these engines have been designed to generate from Anaerobic Digestion (AD) biogas, but will be converted to natural gas and then recommissioned, ahead of the delivery year. The four components of the CMU (referenced VIR097, VIR098, VIR099 and VIR100) are MWM 2020 V12 units (VIR 097 is a MWM 2020 V16), built in 2011 and rated at 1,200kW (VIR097 is rated at 1,560kW). Each engine generates at 415V, which is then stepped up to 6.6kV for export.
PILS19.Location and Post Code: Pilsworth North, Moss Hall Road, Pilsworth, Bury, Lancashire, BL9 7JL

PROEFW.Description of CMU Components: An Energy from Waste facility located in Cheshire.  The Facility will utilise conventional mass-burn technology which is the most proven Energy from Waste technology currently available.  The process will consist of the delivery of waste to the Facility by truck, where it will be deposited in a storage bunker, from which it will be fed into one or two (to be determined) thermal units (or "streams").  Each stream will consist of a moving grate, boiler and air pollution control equipment.  The steam generated will drive a turbine for the generation of electricity.
PROEFW.Location and Post Code:
Plot 8
Protos
Grinsome Road
Elton     CH2 4LF
